name: Azimuth (The Bonsai Treehouse)
description:
AZIMUTH is a game within a game made in Unreal Engine where chasing the highest score comes at the cost of literally corrupting your chances!

Fly through space gates with the WSAD keys to earn points while using mouse pointer controls to fiddle with the cassette tape functions to alter the game itself: 'Fast Forward' to speed things up and keep the points multiplier going, 'Rewind' to slow things down allowing for course corrections and  'Record' to stay invincible for a time! Be warned though: the more you mess with a game tape, the more erratic the obstacles will become, stretching and sliding all over the playing field!

You have up to three other colour-coded game tape 'Back-Ups' in a little box to your right that you can swap between where necessary, whenever the current tape has become too warped for you to play with; just click 'Pause' on the tape deck with your mouse, click on another tape to swap with and click 'Play' to get going again! Collide with an obstacle in the game and you lose the currently used tape. Gain enough points and you can even win back a precious tape in brand spanking new condition, or even a pencil to save your current tape from one further obstacle hit.

AZIMUTH hearkens back to the days of the Apple Macintosh II and Commodore cassette game systems with dexterous controls, satisfyingly clunky mechanical sound design and a retro sci-fi style so war and soft that practically melts through the monitor and glows around the screen!

REMEMBER: High scores will only be saved after a game over; don't quit in the middle of a run if you're serious about going for the gold! To quit the game, press the power button next to the glowing red light to the right-hand side of the in-game computer. Keep your wits about you, because if you lose all your tapes, it's game over!
